description: Mobile techniques used by SharkBot, ATT&CK software S1055 (v1.0)
name: SharkBot (S1055)

techniques.comment: [SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can intercept notifications to send to the C2 server and take advantage of the Direct Reply feature.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use HTTP to send C2 messages to infected devices.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) initially poses as a benign application, then malware is downloaded and executed after an application update.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)

[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use the Android “Direct Reply” feature to spread the malware to other devices. It can also download the full version of the malware after initial device compromise.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) contains domain generation algorithms to use as backups in case the hardcoded C2 domains are unavailable.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use RC4 to encrypt C2 payloads.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) has used RSA to encrypt the symmetric encryption key used for C2 messages.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can exfiltrate captured user credentials and event logs back to the C2 server. (Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) has C2 commands that can uninstall the app from the infected device.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use accessibility event logging to steal data in text fields.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use a WebView with a fake log in site to capture banking credentials.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)

[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use input injection via Accessibility Services to simulate user touch inputs, prevent applications from opening, change device settings, and bypass MFA protections.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use a Domain Generation Algorithm to decode the C2 server location.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)

[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use the “Direct Reply” feature of Android to automatically reply to notifications with a message provided by C2.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can use Accessibility Services to detect which process is in the foreground.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)

[SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can hide and send SMS messages. [SharkBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1055) can also change which application is the device’s default SMS handler.(Citation: nccgroup_sharkbot_0322)
